alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Houston; Jones; Monroe; Twiggs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 06 at 3:44AM EST until February 07 at 10:16PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Conasauga River near Tilton affecting Whitfield, Gordon and Murray Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oostanaula River near Calhoun affecting Gordon County. Flint River near Griffin Hwy. 16 affecting Fayette and Spalding Counties. Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Jones, Houston, Bibb, Monroe and Twiggs Counties. Oconee River near Oconee affecting Wilkinson and Washington Counties. Oconee River near Penfield affecting Greene, Oconee and Clarke Counties. Oconee River near Oconee affecting Wilkinson, Washington and Johnson Counties. For the Conasauga River Basin...including Eton, Crandall, Dalton, Keiths Mill near Dalton, Chatsworth, Tilton, Sloan Bridge near Dalton...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Flint River Basin...including Lake Kedron Tailrace, Lake Horton, Lovejoy, Americus, Lake Peachtree Tailrace, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Below Lake McIntosh, Senoia, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Griffin Hwy. 16, Molena, Thomaston, Carsonville Hwy. 19, Montezuma, Byromville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Juliette, Griffin, East Juliette, West Macon, Dames Ferry, Macon, Hawkinsville, Byron, Hawkinsville, Clinchfield, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River near Macon. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 21 feet, Minor flooding expands. An increasing amount of the Macon GreenWay Ocmulgee Heritage Trail floods north of the Martin Luther King Boulevard bridge. The flood waters will be up to two feet deep on portions of the trail and both banks overflow upstream from the bridge. Large portions of agricultural lands east of Macon and well downstream will be under 1 to 4 feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM EST Sunday the stage was 21.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 AM EST Sunday was 21.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.8 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 18 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.8 feet on 05/09/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
